title: The
abstract: Knee osteoarthritis (KOA) is a multifactorial and degenerative disease. Growth differentiation factor 5 ( This cross-sectional observational study enrolled 224 Brazilian patients with KOA, who were evaluated and classified according to disease severity. The median age was 64 (44-84) years; 75.9% of the patients were female, 50.9% were shorter than 1.60 m, and 67.4% were obese or morbidly obese. The disease severity distribution was 64.7% grades I-III and 35.3% IV-V. Patients with KOA who were over 70 years had significantly more advanced grades (OR = 9.3; 95% CI = 3.4-26), in either female group (OR = 8.2; 95% CI = 2.6-26).
